result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark R Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark R Sullivan in court with attorney David Michael Stegall.  Defendant Mark R Sullivan in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM78 & 16CM86 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will continue on Probation on the Felony cases; probation is just revoking these two cases.  Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Stegall has received a copy of the the revocation packet and has met with the defendant before court today; no corrections or additions. 

Atty Hendee makes a statement on credit and believes that it should be 37 days for these cases.  Atty Stegall agrees with the 37 days but feels that some should be taken out of the original credit amount.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Stegall makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  16CM78 & 16CM86:  Court orders 4 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on each count; concurrent to any other sentence
Defendant is to remain in custody
May transfer to Dane County or Rock County
Credit = 42 days
Continue with all the conditions of Probation
Costs and surcharges will be converted to a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 8, 2017 at 11:00 am. Approved BNB 5-4-17

Defendant Mark R Sullivan in court with attorney David Michael Stegall.  Defendant Mark R Sullivan in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF45, 16CF65, 16CF66, 16CM78, 16CM86, 16TR1759, 16TR1760, 16TR1761, 16TR1762, 16CF78 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 16CM78, Ct. 2 in 16CM86, Ct. 1 in 16CF45, Ct. 1 in 16CF65 & Ct. 1 in 16CF78.  All other counts in all matters to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee has no objection to early termination of probation after 24 months if the DOC is in agreement.
Atty Stegall agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 16CM78, Ct. 2 in 16CM86, Ct. 1 in 16CF45, Ct. 1 in 16CF65 & Ct. 1 in 16CF78.
All other counts in all matters to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.    State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Stegall makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the agreement.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 16CM78, Ct. 2 in 16CM86, Ct. 1 in 16CF45, Ct. 1 in 16CF65 & Ct. 1 in 16CF78:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions on the felony matters and 24 months Probation on the Misd. matters.
*Court Costs = $268.00 x 3
*Court Costs = $243.00 x 2
*Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $100.00 x 2
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge x 3
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge x 2
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Contact with the victim N.H. will be at the discretion of the Agent
*Credit = 117 days (if revoked)
All other counts in all matters to be dismissed and read-in.
*Defendant may have early termination of probation after 24 months if full compliance and if the DOC is in agreement.
 
 **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

**DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED
**AMENDED NO CONTACT CONDITION ONLY:  *No contact with N.H. or G.H. except through telephone or face to face contact at the jail only.

Defendant Mark R Sullivan in court with attorney David Michael Stegall.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF45, 16CF65, 16CF66, 16CM78, 16CM86, 16TR1759, 16TR1760, 16TR1761, 16TR1762, 16CF78 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the motion is at the request of the victims to lift the no contact.  Atty Hendee states that 16CM78 pertains to the no contact with G.H.
Atty Hendee states that both victims request that the no contact be lifted completely.  Atty Hendee does not object to modify the no contact for each victim to a no contact except for contact through telephone while the defendant is in custody.  Atty Hendee states that the case in LaCrosse County is that same condition.
Atty Stegall asks for recorded contact for the victims.  
Court questions N.H.  N.H. asks that the no contact be lifted.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will modify the no contact condition on all bonds to No contact with N.H. or G.H. except through telephone or face to face contact at the jail only.
for Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond
to Court from Nichole Hayes regarding BOND conditions

Defendant Mark R Sullivan in court with attorney David Michael Stegall.  Defendant Mark R Sullivan in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF45, 16CF65, 16CF66, 16CF78, 16CM78, 16CM86, 16TR1759, 16TR1760, 16TR1761 & 16TR1762 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Stegall; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Stegall agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Stegall states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions counsel regarding the cash bond motions.  Atty Hendee requests the cash bonds be forfieted and makes arguments.  Atty Stegall states that Ms. Sullivan is in the courtroom and would like to say something after his arguments.  Atty Stegall makes arguments for the return of the cash bonds.  Ms. Sullivan makes a statement to the court.  Atty Hendee makes arguments and asks the court to forfiet the bonds.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders that $5,000 of the cash bonds will be forfieted.  The remainder of the cash bonds will be returned to the party that posted it.
Set all matters for trial.
Bond continued in all matters.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am
in custody
of warrant cancellation
- copy to MASO by DA

Attorney David Michael Stegall in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF45, 16CF65, 16CF66, 16CM78, 16CM86, 16TR1759, 16TR1760, 16TR1761, 16TR1762, 16CF78 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that he has just filed new charges, 16CF78.  Atty Hendee requests a warrant on all cases and forfieture of the bonds in all cases.  Atty Stegall requests that the forfieture of the bonds be held open for a motion to a later date.  Atty Hendee clarifies his motion for the bond forfietures.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized on all cases.  Cash bond forfietures will be set for hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 09:45 am.

16CF45, 16CF65, 16CF66, 16CM78 & 16CM86 tracking together:
16CF65 & 16CF66 Prelim:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Stegall; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Stegall agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Stegall states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on both cases on behalf of the defendant.

bond continued in all matters  Return date scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Notice of retainer and request to reschedule was faxed 8/16/16 and approved by Court on 8/17/16.  Was not entered into system immediately.  Warrant should not have been issued on 8/18/16.  Cancel warrant.

  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

Statement of Compliance
Signed by Carol I. Jaksic
Victim Witness Coordinator

Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on August 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Mark R Sullivan in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial

Mr. Sullivan asks for a modification of the cash bond.  Atty Hendee responds and asks the court to deny the bond modification request.  Defendant argues that he has never missed a court date and asks that the bond be returned to his family.
BY THE COURT:  Request to modify bond is denied; bond will be continued.

Court received a letter from the victim asking to lift the no contact.  Atty Hendee has not received the letter yet and asks that the normal steps be taken for that request.
BY THE COURT:  Victim is to contact the victim witness coordinator.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
from Nicole Hayes requesting the no contact order be lifted
